data.event: Founding of Brewster: The town of Brewster was in established in the spring of 1872, but was known for many years as Hersey.
Founding of Brewster: The town of Brewster was in established in the spring of 1872, but was known for many years as Hersey.

event.title: was run by A. J. Timlin for many years

data.event: T. J. Smith put up the first store which was run by A. J. Timlin for many years.
All of this occurred in 1872, the same year that A. J. Timlin became postmaster.

event.title: 1880, the St. Paul and Sioux City Railroad was purchased

data.event: Source of name: In 1880, the St. Paul and Sioux City Railroad was purchased by the Chicago, St. Paul, Minneapolis and Omaha Railway, or the Omaha Road, and there was already a station named Hersey on the latter road's track in Wisconsin.
